ygData.subject: Re: Center of attention
ygData.msgSnippet: That s one of the things I really enjoy about this list too, it makes me feel like less of a weirdo. I ve played bards in AD&D for about as long as I have been
ygData.messageBody:
That's one of the things I really enjoy about this list too, it makes me
feel like less of a weirdo. I've played bards in AD&D for about as long as I
have been playing, only to have other people that I RPG with snigger and ask
why I would want to. EQ, like some of the other MUD's I have played over the
years, really does a good job at making the bard fun to play. It's great to
randomly group with people who say things like "You bards kick ass" or
"Travelling with a bard in the party is a pleasure." Now if we could just
charm lots of mobs at lower levels I'd be in heaven.

Okay on to more serious business. I completed the Ogre Head Quest in
Butcherblock last night by dropping off the heads of two named Ogres
(Corflunk and Zarcoomi) to Byzar Bloddforge in Kaladim. As a reward I
received a Blackened Iron Crown
(http://gameznet.com/eq/equipment/EQ-Blackened.Iron.Crown.html)

which I thought was pretty nifty. This morning I was browsing Everlore and
someone had remarked that this item had been sold at auction for 250pp. I
just about passed out with dreams of avarice. Anyone have an idea if this is
even near to being true? If so I am camping in BB for a while longer.

Bernwyn
Balladeer or the 11th Verse, small trinkets dealer




----- Original Message -----
From: Llewrend Lynnhaven <lordartos@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 20, 1999 12:18 PM
Subject: [eqbards] Center of attention


> From: Llewrend Lynnhaven <lordartos@...>
>
> Well, one thing I like about this group is you all
> actually LIKE playing a bard. That may sound silly
> but a lot of message boards out there are just
> whinning about the class.
>
> Anyway, I had heard about the 'tauting' effects of our
> songs, but for the most part, it never bothered me,
> sure I get the mobs attention, and even take a lot of
> dammage, no biggie, just make nice with the cleric.
> Well, after turning 21, Guk and Unrest have become
> whole new places.
>
> First guk, near the scryer room my party of six where
> bashing every froglock in sight, gaining massive exp
> and loot. So we say, what the heck, lets go in the
> room. Well, on knight comes after us, so I use my
> melodic binding song that I love so much. Big
> mistake, from behind one of our tanks I saw no less
> than 15 assorted froglocks come up the stairs, and who
> do you think they were headed for? Well, after about
> 5 minutes of root, root, root, root, I was taking the
> long walk back from freeport. Get back, grab my
> stuff, play anthem for my friends in battle, and what
> do you think happened? Again, I'm dragged down under
> a sea of amphibious flesh. So after a while, I say,
> heck, I'll head over to good ole unrest, what could be
> safer? Get there, find some good friends I could
> trust, and we get to slayin undead. One of the dry
> bones makes a run for the house, silly bard that I am,
> I chase him, again, still singing a song, forget which
> one. Withing seconds the doors fly open and carrion,
> monks and the reclusive ghoul magi beeline right at
> the wide eyed me, who didn't even have time to type in
> a profanity. So I come back from butchers block.
> Fighting a while, see a wisp to the left of the house,
> facing the back. Someone in my guild needed a light
> stone, so I run to grab it, while singing my little
> anthem. All of a sudden, the hag 3 floors up starts
> casting on me from a window, and I wake up at home
> among the trees. That sucked. Does this mean we
> can't use any of our aoe or buffs anywhere near a
> dungeon? Well, at least my calves are built up from
> zone running :)
>
> Llewrend Lynnhaven
> 21rst song
> E Marr
>
